com.loicfrance.library.utils

Class Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.loicfrance.library.utils.Settings

  • public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
    a useful static class with methods and listeners on Preferences, to use with an instance of SettingsSet via setSettingsSet(SettingsSet).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Settings.OnSettingChangeListener
      A Listener interface used to be notified when a preference has changes.
      static class  Settings.TYPE
      An enumeration to define the different types of data that can be used in preference values.

        public static void removeOnSettingChangeListener(Settings.OnSettingChangeListener listener)

      • set

        public static void set(java.lang.String key,

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key,
                                         java.lang.String def)
        returns the saved preference value for the given key, or the default value if the preference does not exists.
        Do not forget to call the init(Context, SettingsSet) method to initialize the Settings class.
        Parameters:
        key - preference key
        def - default value
        Returns:
        preference value for key, or default value if unknown

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key)
        returns the saved preference value for the given key, or the default value if the preference does not exists.
        The default value is defined in the SettingsSet instance specified in the init(Context, SettingsSet) function parameters, or via the setSettingsSet(SettingsSet) function.
        Do not forget to call the init(Context, SettingsSet) method to initialize the Settings class.
        Parameters:
        key - preference key
        Returns:
        preference value for key, or default value if unknown

      • reset

        public static void reset(java.lang.String key)
        sets the specified preference to its default value from the associated SettingsSet instance.
        Parameters:
        key - prefernce key

      • resetAll

        public static void resetAll()
        sets all preferences to their default values from the associated SettingsSet instance.

      • init

        public static boolean init(@NonNull
                           android.content.Context context,
                           @NonNull
                           SettingsSet sSet)
        Initializes the Settings class by linking it to the preferences and the specified SettingsSet instance, containing all the preference keys informations.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context instance used to get the preferences.
        sSet - the SettingsSet instance containing all the preference keys.
        Returns:
        true is everything is ready to be used, false if an error occured somewhere

      • getSettingsSet

        public static SettingsSet getSettingsSet()
        Returns the SettingsSet instance associated to the Settings class.
        Remember that the Settings class will not work completely unless you specify it a SettingsSet instance to work with. You can specify one using the setSettingsSet(SettingsSet) function, or using the init(Context, SettingsSet) function to do it in the same time as linking with the preferences.
        Returns:
        the SettingsSet instance associated to the Settings class, or null if not set.
        See Also:
        setSettingsSet(SettingsSet), init(Context, SettingsSet)

      • setSettingsSet

        public static void setSettingsSet(@NonNull
                                  SettingsSet sSet)
        Sets the SettingsSet instance for the Settings class to work with.
        This function must be called before the createPref(Context) function.
        Those two function are automatically called in the init(Context, SettingsSet) function.
        You can use the init(Context, SettingsSet) function to initialize it in the same time as linking with the preferences.
        Parameters:
        sSet - the object the class will use to get all preferences keys, types and default values.

      • createPref

        public static void createPref(android.content.Context context)
        Links the Settings class with the preferences.
        This function must be called after a SettingsSet instance has been linked to the Settings class.
        This function is automatically called in the init(Context, SettingsSet) function.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context class to take the preferences from.

      • isPrefsCreated

        public static boolean isPrefsCreated()
        Checks ig the Settings class as well been initialized.
        Returns:
        true if the Settings are ready to be used, false otherwise.

      • printAll

        public static void printAll()
        prints the values of all preferences in the log.
        The used format is the following :
        *key* = *value*
